text: Mastering others is strength, mastering yourself is true power.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Successful people tend to become more successful because they are always thinking about their successes.
author: Brian Tracy

text: Men do not attract which they want but that which they are.
author: James Allen

text: Success is doing what you want to do, when you want, where you want, with whom you want, as much as you want.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Don't learn to do, but learn in doing.
author: Samuel Butler

text: Where there's life, there's hope.
author: Stephen Hawking

text: What loneliness is more lonely than distrust?
author: George Eliot

text: There exists only the present instant; a Now which always and without end is itself new.
author: Meister Eckhart

text: The soul should always stand ajar, ready to welcome the ecstatic experience.
author: Emily Dickinson

text: Great things happen to those who don't stop believing, trying, learning, and being grateful.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: Most people achieved their greatest success one step beyond what looked like their greatest failure.
author: Brian Tracy

text: Live calmly. The time will come when the flowers bloom by themselves.
author: Zen Proverb

text: The important thing is not what one is born with but what use one makes of that equipment.
author: Alfred Adler

text: Don't concern yourself with the money. Be of service. Build. Work. Dream. Create.
author: Earl Nightingale

text: To the world you may be one person; but to one person you may be the world.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: Learn from the mistakes of others. You can't live long enough to make them all yourself.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Peace if possible, truth at all costs.
author: Martin Luther

text: There is no absolute success in the world, only constant progress.
author: Jonathan Swift

text: If you don't know where you're going, you will probably end up somewhere else.
author: Laurence J. Peter

text: It's not the men in your life that matters, it's the life in your men.
author: Mae West

text: The wisest men follow their own direction.
author: Euripides

text: Study logic and math, because once you've mastered them, you won't fear any book.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: Working hard for something we don't care about is called stress: Working hard for something we love is called passion.
author: Simon Sinek

text: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance you must keep moving.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Love the life you live, live the life you love.
author: Bob Marley

text: The dead receive more flowers than the living because regret is stronger than gratitude.
author: Anne Frank

text: Without struggle, no progress and no result. Every breaking of habit produces a change in the machine.
author: G.I. Gurdjieff

text: Time doesn't heal emotional pain, you need to learn how to let go.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: The cost of leadership is self-interest.
author: Simon Sinek

text: Don't let the past steal your present.
author: Cherralea Morgen

text: Opportunity comes when you continually push forward.
author: Sonia Ricotti

text: Anything you may hold firmly in your imagination can be yours.
author: William James

text: Success is good at any age, but the sooner you find it, the longer you will enjoy it.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: When you have a dream, you've got to grab it and never let go.
author: Carol Burnett

text: For changes to be of any true value, they've got to be lasting and consistent.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Sometimes you have to shut your eyes, so you can see the real beauty.
author: Kilian Jornet

text: Help others achieve their dreams and you will achieve yours.
author: Les Brown

text: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone elses. life.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Integrity is the ability to stand by an idea.
author: Ayn Rand

text: It's easier to lose than to win.
author: Wayne Gretzky

text: It is not the knowing that is difficult, but the doing.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: Let the beauty of what you love be what you do.
author: Rumi

text: One must be poor to know the luxury of giving.
author: George Eliot

text: I am not the outcome. I am never the result. I am only the effort.
author: Kamal Ravikant

text: Never stand begging for that which you have the power to earn.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

text: Anger begins with folly, and ends with repentance.
author: Beverly Sills

text: Be the change that you want to see in the world.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: It is not because things are difficult that we do not dare; it is because we do not dare that things are difficult.
author: Seneca

text: Empty your mind, be formless.
author: Bruce Lee

text: Experience is simply the name we give our mistakes.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: To seek is to suffer. To seek nothing is bliss.
author: Bodhidharma

text: What a liberation to realize that 'the voice in my head' is not who I am. Who am I then? The one who sees that.
author: Eckhart Tolle

text: If you do not tell the truth about yourself you cannot tell it about other people.
author: Virginia Woolf

text: True life is lived when tiny changes occur.
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: it's important to make sure that we're talking with each other in a way that heals, not in a way that wounds.
author: Barack Obama

text: Dreams do come true, if we only wish hard enough, You can have anything in life if you will sacrifice everything else for it.
author: James Matthew Barrie

text: The greatest test of courage on earth is to bear defeat without losing heart.
author: Robert Greene

text: The hardest arithmetic to master is that which enables us to count our blessings.
author: Eric Hoffer

text: Life is 10% what happens to you and 90% how you react to it.
author: Charles Swindoll

text: All that a man achieves and all that he fails to achieve is the direct result of his own thoughts.
author: James Allen

text: A man is great not because he hasn't failed; a man is great because failure hasn't stopped him.
author: Confucius

text: All religions, arts and sciences are branches of the same tree.
author: Albert Einstein

text: If you want to be happy, do not dwell in the past, do not worry about the future, focus on living fully in the present.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: A successful man is one who can lay a firm foundation with the bricks others have thrown at him.
author: David Brinkley

text: Our view of the world is truly shaped by what we decide to hear.
author: William James

text: A day wasted on others is not wasted on one's self.
author: Charles Dickens

text: Everything is possible. The impossible just takes longer.
author: Dan Brown

text: To be prepared is half the victory.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

text: Accept responsibility for your life. Know that it is you who will get you where you want to go, no one else.
author: Les Brown

text: Listen to what you know instead of what you fear.
author: Richard Bach

text: Reversing your treatment of the man you have wronged is better than asking his forgiveness.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: We forge the chains we wear in life.
author: Charles Dickens

text: Any game becomes important when you know and love the players.
author: W.P. Kinsella

text: If a thing is worth doing, it is worth doing badly.
author: Gilbert Chesterton

text: What the mind can conceive, it can achieve.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: Forget yesterday - it has already forgotten you. Don't sweat tomorrow - you haven't even met. Instead, open your eyes and your heart to a truly precious gift ? today.
author: Steve Maraboli

text: Talk sense to a fool and he calls you foolish.
author: Euripides

text: The moment you doubt whether you can fly, you cease for ever to be able to do it.
author: James Matthew Barrie

text: The sculptor produces the beautiful statue by chipping away such parts of the marble block as are not needed - it is a process of elimination.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: As one grows weaker one is less susceptible to suffering. There is less hurt because there is less to hurt.
author: Jack London

text: In the End, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

text: Dreams are the touchstones of our characters.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: There are no uninteresting things, only uninterested people.
author: Gilbert Chesterton

text: You can start changing our world for the better daily, no matter how small the action.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: If I can laugh, I can live.
author: Christopher Reeve

text: It's always to soon to quit!
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: Never be afraid to raise your voice for honesty and truth and compassion against injustice and lying and greed.
author: William Faulkner

text: Leadership is solving problems
author: Colin Powell

text: The strongest and sweetest songs yet remain to be sung.
author: Walt Whitman

text: The most important single ingredient in the formula of success is knowing how to get along with people.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: A man is but a product of his thoughts. What he thinks he becomes.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: It is indeed a radical act of love just to sit down and be quiet for a time by yourself.
author: Jon Kabat-Zinn

text: Just get out and do it. You will be very, very glad that you did.
author: Christopher McCandless

text: Success is going from failure to failure without losing your enthusiasm
author: Winston Churchill

text: The truth is not for all men, but for those who seek it.
author: Ayn Rand

text: A rational person can find peace by cultivating indifference to things outside of their control.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: None are more hopelessly enslaved than those who falsely believe they are free.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: An inventor is a man who asks Why? of the universe and lets nothing stand between the answer and his mind.
author: Ayn Rand

text: Experience is a comb which nature gives us when we are bald.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: Great ones are willing to get burned time and again as they sharpen their swords in the fire.
author: Josh Waitzkin

text: Rest and be kind, you don't have to prove anything.
author: Jack Kerouac

text: Trust your instincts: my first reaction is almost invariably the right one.
author: Estee Lauder

text: You have a brain and mind of your own. Use it, and reach your own decisions.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: Success is getting what you want... Happiness is wanting what you get.
author: Dale Carnegie

text: The law of harvest is to reap more than you sow. Sow an act, and you reap a habit. Sow a habit and you reap a character. Sow a character and you reap a destiny.
author: James Allen

text: None but ourselves can free our minds.
author: Bob Marley

text: Disobedience is the true foundation of liberty. The obedient must be slaves.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: The most virtuous are those who content themselves with being virtuous without seeking to appear so.
author: Plato

text: Never do to others what you would not like them to do to you.
author: Confucius

text: Great loves too must be endured.
author: Coco Chanel

text: Throw me to the wolves and I will return leading the pack.
author: Seneca

text: To do two things at once is to do neither.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: We take care of the future best by taking care of the present now.
author: Jon Kabat-Zinn

text: If you pick up a starving dog and make him prosperous he will not bite you. This is the principal difference between a dog and man.
author: Mark Twain

text: Who you are is always right.
author: Ming-Dao Deng

text: If you hang out with chickens, you're going to cluck and if you hang out with eagles, you're going to fly.
author: Steve Maraboli

text: Fear does not have any special power unless you empower it by submitting to it.
author: Les Brown

text: If you want to achieve anything in this world, you have to get used to the idea that not everyone will like you.
author: Simon Sinek

text: Repetition does not transform a lie into a truth.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: If we did all the things we are capable of, we would literally astound ourselves.
author: Thomas Edison

text: All power is from within and therefore under our control.
author: Robert Collier

text: Greatness comes from living with purpose and passion.
author: Ralph Marston

text: The person who cannot control his words shows that he cannot control himself.
author: Robert Greene

text: Without the rain there would be no rainbow.
author: Gilbert Chesterton

text: First learn the meaning of what you say, and then speak.
author: Epictetus

text: Anyone who reads a book with a sense of obligation does not understand the art of reading.
author: Lin Yutang

text: It's easy to wish for health when you're sick.  When you're doing well, you need just as much vigilance.
author: Kamal Ravikant

text: Have the courage to be ignorant of a great number of things, in order to avoid the calamity of being ignorant of everything.
author: Sydney Smith

text: Money is only a tool. It will take you wherever you wish, but it will not replace you as the driver.
author: Ayn Rand

text: I am not proud, but I am happy; and happiness blinds, I think, more than pride.
author: Alexandre Dumas

text: It is never too late to be what you might have been.
author: George Eliot

text: Ability is a poor man's wealth.
author: John Wooden

text: If you do not push the boundaries, you will never know where they are.
author: T.S. Eliot

text: The biggest and only critic lives in your perception of people's perception of you rather than people's perception of you.
author: Criss Jami

text: Believe in yourself! Have faith in your abilities! Without a humble but reasonable confidence in your own powers you cannot be successful or happy.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: You cannot control the behavior of others, but you can always choose how you respond to it.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: The goal is not to show how great you are to others, but how vulnerable you are to yourself.
author: Maxime Lagace

text: The glow of one warm thought is to me worth more than money.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: The ego wants comfort and certainty. The soul wants to live fully.
author: Maxime Lagace

text: Create with the heart; build with the mind.
author: Criss Jami

text: Any fool can paint a picture, but it takes a wise man to be able to sell it.
author: Samuel Butler

text: Everyone has oceans to fly, if they have the heart to do it. Is it reckless? Maybe. But what do dreams know of boundaries.
author: Amelia Earhart

text: Nothing will work unless you do.
author: Maya Angelou

text: Be like a postage stamp. Stick to it until you get there.
author: Bob Proctor

text: If you aren't sure which way to do something, do it both ways and see which works better.
author: John Carmack

text: In the end, it's not the years in your life that count. It's the life in your years.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: A bird does not sing because it has an answer. It sings because it has a song.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: Creative endeavors are by their nature uncertain.
author: Robert Greene

text: Sometimes you will never know the value of something, until it becomes a memory.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: Cultivate the merry heart, develop the happiness habit, and life will become a continual feast.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: Work is always an antidote to depression.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: The friend is the man who knows all about you, and still likes you.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: Insanity is relative. It depends on who has who locked in what cage.
author: Ray Bradbury

text: Cherish forever what makes you unique, cuz you're really a yawn if it goes.
author: Bette Midler

text: Before you speak, ask yourself, is it kind, is it necessary, is it true, does it improve the silence?
author: Sathya Sai Baba

text: If I persist long enough I will win.
author: Og Mandino

text: Everything has its beauty, but not everyone sees it.
author: Confucius

text: He is richest who is content with the least, for content is the wealth of nature.
author: Socrates

text: It matters not who you love, where you love, why you love, when you love or how you love, it matters only that you love.
author: John Lennon

text: Everyone has the right to make his own decisions, but none has the right to force his decision on others.
author: Ayn Rand

text: Enjoy life. There's plenty of time to be dead.
author: Hans Christian Andersen

text: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.
author: Buddha

text: Success is the child of drudgery and perseverance. It cannot be coaxed or bribed; pay the price and it is yours.
author: Orison Swett Marden

text: Fool me once, shame on you; fool me twice, shame on me.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: Act the way you want to be and soon you'll be the way you act.
author: Les Brown

text: Only by acceptance of the past, can you alter it.
author: T.S. Eliot

text: You can avoid reality, but you cannot avoid the consequences of avoiding reality.
author: Ayn Rand

text: Every person, all the events of your life are there because you have drawn them there. What you choose to do with them is up to you.
author: Richard Bach

text: We can either add to our character each day, or we can fritter away our energies in distractions.
author: Ming-Dao Deng

text: A fool sees himself as another, but a wise man sees others as himself.
author: Dogen

text: The only problem we really have is we think we're not supposed to have problems! Problems call us to higher level- - face & solve them now!
author: Tony Robbins

text: Power is not what we do but what we do not - hasty and unwise actions that we repeat every day and which ultimately bring us into trouble.
author: Robert Greene

text: A tiger doesn't lose sleep over the opinion of sheep.
author: Shahir Zag

text: Do not think you will necessarily be aware of your own enlightenment.
author: Dogen

text: To some degree, you control your life by controlling your time.
author: Conrad Hilton

text: Self-control is strength.
author: James Allen

text: It is startling to realize how much unbelief is necessary to make belief possible.
author: Eric Hoffer

text: Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day. Teach a man to fish and you feed him for a lifetime.
author: Lao Tzu

text: If life is a video game, the graphics are great, but the plot is confusing and the tutorial is way too long.
author: Elon Musk

text: Time and health are two precious assets that we don't recognize and appreciate until they have been depleted.
author: Denis Waitley

text: Do not stop thinking of life as an adventure.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: A flower falls, even though we love it; and a weed grows, even though we do not love it.
author: Dogen

text: It is important that we forgive ourselves for making mistakes. We need to learn from our errors and move on.
author: Steve Maraboli

text: If you are going to achieve excellence in big things, you develop the habit in little matters.
author: Colin Powell

text: In the practice of tolerance, one's enemy is the best teacher.
author: Dalai Lama

text: A random act of kindness, no matter how small, can make a tremendous impact on someone else's life.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: Correct what you can. Learn from what you can't.
author: Toni Morrison

text: Realize deeply that the present moment is all you have. Make the NOW the primary focus of your life.
author: Eckhart Tolle

text: When one does not have what one wants, one must want what one has.
author: Sigmund Freud

text: You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: The best fighter is never angry.
author: Lao Tzu

text: We create the world and ourselves;
author: Ming-Dao Deng

text: If you put water into a cup, it becomes the cup.
author: Bruce Lee

text: Expect the best, plan for the worst, and prepare to be surprised.
author: Denis Waitley

text: A tiny change today brings a dramatically different tomorrow.
author: Richard Bach

text: Saying nothing sometimes says the most.
author: Emily Dickinson

text: Nothing makes a man broad-minded like adversity.
author: Will Rogers

text: Don't live the same year 75 times and call it a life.
author: Robin Sharma

text: Confidence breeds beauty.
author: Estee Lauder

text: A man has to learn that he cannot command things but that he can command himself; that he cannot coerce the wills of others but that he can mold and master his own will.
author: James Allen

text: In the midst of chaos, there is also opportunity.
author: Sun Tzu

text: Every day is an opportunity to a make a new happy ending.
author: Jonathan Swift

text: Wealth is the product of man's capacity to think.
author: Ayn Rand

text: Love is the expression of one's values.
author: Ayn Rand

text: You are not stuck where you are unless you decide to be.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: The future doesn't belong to the faint-hearted; it belongs to the brave.
author: Ronald Reagan

text: Shoot for the moon, because even if you miss, you'll land among the stars.
author: Les Brown

text: You can't let your failures define you. You have to let your failures teach you.
author: Barack Obama

text: The wise warrior avoids the battle.
author: Sun Tzu

text: Each time we don't say what we wanna say, we're dying.
author: Yoko Ono

text: Do not be awe struck by other people and try to copy them. Nobody can be you as efficiently as you can.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: Stop acting so small. You are the universe in ecstatic motion.
author: Rumi

text: A strong man overcomes an obstacle, a wise man goes the whole way.
author: Zen Proverb

text: The first step is to establish that something is possible; then probability will occur.
author: Elon Musk

text: Paths are made by walking.
author: Franz Kafka

text: Surround yourself with people who take their work seriously, but not themselves, those who work hard and play hard.
author: Colin Powell

text: Success is nothing more than a few simple disciplines practiced every day.
author: Jim Rohn

text: It's better to have a short life that is full of what you like doing, than a long life spent in a miserable way.
author: Alan Watts

text: Plants grow weak without wind.
author: Maxime Lagace

text: One of the most difficult things is not to change society - but to change yourself.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: The smallest act of kindness is worth more than the greatest intention.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: Creativity is intelligence having fun.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Excellence is not a skill. It is an attitude.
author: Ralph Marston

text: Great leaders are almost always great simplifiers, who can cut through argument, debate and doubt, to offer a solution everybody can understand.
author: Colin Powell

text: The only thing worse than being blind is having sight but no vision.
author: Helen Keller

text: Friendship is like money, easier made than kept.
author: Samuel Butler

text: There are no shortcuts to any place worth going.
author: Beverly Sills

text: New beginnings are disguised as painful endings.
author: Lao Tzu

text: When you are able to employ your will always for constructive purposes, you become the controller of your destiny.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

text: Pain doesn't last. And when it's gone, we have something to show for it. Growth.
author: Kamal Ravikant

text: It is under the greatest adversity that there exists the greatest potential for doing good, both for oneself and others.
author: Dalai Lama

text: If you go out looking for friends, you're going to find they are very scarce. If you go out to be a friend, you'll find them everywhere.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: The power to make and break habits and learning how to do that is really important.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: The pessimist sees difficulty in every opportunity. The optimist sees opportunity in every difficulty.
author: Winston Churchill

text: People have the illusion that all over the world, all the time, all kinds of fantastic things are happening.
author: David Brinkley

text: Everything around us is made up of energy. To attract positive things in your life, start by giving off positive energy.
author: Celestine Chua

text: Words, once they are printed, have a life of their own.
author: Carol Burnett

text: The person who says something is impossible should not interrupt the person who is doing it.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: You have to keep breaking your heart until it opens.
author: Rumi

text: If you put yourself in a position where you have to stretch outside your comfort zone, then you are forced to expand your consciousness.
author: Unknown

text: Learn from the rejection and turn it into an opportunity!
author: Mary Engelbreit

text: No matter how much preparation we do, in the real tests of our lives, we'll be in unfamiliar terrain.
author: Josh Waitzkin

text: My favorite things in life don't cost any money. It's really clear that the most precious resource we all have is time.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Whatever you believe with feeling becomes your reality.
author: Brian Tracy

text: A fall into a ditch makes you wiser.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: Looking after my health today gives me a better hope for tomorrow.
author: Anne Wilson Schaef

text: A loving heart is the truest wisdom.
author: Charles Dickens

text: Make your life a mission - not an intermission.
author: Unknown
